law.catch_line: An authority of a municipal corporation or Baltimore City may:...

text.section:
An authority of a municipal corporation or Baltimore City may:
operate within its territorial boundaries; and
without regard to location:
administer rent subsidy payments and housing assistance programs for both eligible landlords and tenants;
own or manage housing projects in operation before January 1, 1990; and
develop, own, or operate a housing project at the request of and within the territorial boundaries of another political subdivision.

section.section:
Anywhere in its county an authority of a county may:
administer rent subsidy payments and housing assistance programs for both eligible landlords and tenants; and
own or manage housing projects in operation before:
January 1, 1990, if the authority is of Baltimore City; or
January 1, 1991, if the authority is of another county.
Subject to paragraph (3) of this subsection, an authority of a county may conduct its other operations within the county.

An authority of a county other than Baltimore City may not conduct its other operations within a municipal corporation unless the governing body of the municipal corporation consents by resolution to its inclusion in the authority's area of operation.

text.section: An authority created under § 12-208 of this title may conduct its operations in the area prescribed under its articles of organization.
